meaningMnemonic: There’s a <radical>stone</radical>, a <radical>tree</radical>, another <radical>tree</radical>, and a <radical>coat rack</radical>. That stone and two trees will make the perfect <kanji>foundation</kanji>, or <kanji>cornerstone</kanji>, for a house to put that coat rack in! This stone is flat and heavy and both of the trees are flexible and durable.
readingMnemonic: After you finish the <kanji>foundation</kanji>, the only step that's left is to wash the entire thing with <reading>so</reading>ap (そ).
